docs.title: Payment Verdict
docs.text:
This site exists to answer one question:

Does a system have the right to continue executing a payment action without new, explicit authorization?

Payment failures, retries, and automation errors are not purely technical issues. When execution may cause irreversible consequences, continuation becomes a legitimacy question.

This site provides judgment boundaries for: - Payment retry decisions - Unknown or partial payment states - Automation without explicit confirmation

It is not a payment tutorial. It is a judgment reference.

docs.title: Disclaimer
docs.text:
This site provides judgment references only.

It does not offer legal advice, payment instructions, or operational guarantees.

All execution decisions and consequences remain the responsibility of the decision-maker.

docs.title: Extended Judgment Reference
docs.text:
This site provides public judgment boundaries.

If you require: - A clear retry verdict for a real incident - A responsibility boundary reference - A written legitimacy determination for internal use

This is not a subscription. This is a one-time judgment reference.

docs.title: Payment Problem Scenarios
docs.text: This section describes common payment execution situations that appear as technical failures but require judgment.

docs.title: Situation
docs.text: A payment execution enters a state where the system cannot clearly determine whether the action has completed successfully.

docs.title: Why this is not a normal failure
docs.text: Payment systems may process requests asynchronously. Missing or delayed signals do not reliably indicate non-execution.

docs.title: Risk boundary
docs.text: Continuing execution may introduce: - Duplicate charges - Conflicting transaction states - Improper responsibility transfer to automation

docs.title: Judgment note
docs.text: When execution outcomes are irreversible, lack of confirmation is not sufficient justification to continue.

docs.title: Situation
docs.text: A payment attempt returns a failure response, or the client receives an error during execution.

docs.title: Why this is not purely a technical problem
docs.text: A failure response does not always mean that no execution occurred. Payment systems may process requests asynchronously or partially.

docs.title: Risk boundary
docs.text: Retrying a failed payment may result in: - Duplicate charges - Inconsistent transaction records - Responsibility being shifted to the system

docs.title: Judgment note
docs.text: When execution results are irreversible, failure alone is not sufficient justification for retry. A legitimacy check is required before continuing.

docs.title: Stripe Subscription Payment Failed — Verdict
docs.text:
This page provides a Stripe-specific judgment view of the following problem:

  • Payment failed during an active subscription lifecycle

For general payment failure patterns, see: - /problems/payment-failed/

docs.title: Verdict
docs.text:
In most cases, this situation requires careful timing judgment, not immediate action.

This verdict does not execute retries, cancellations, or refunds. It only answers whether human intervention is required now.

docs.title: Automation Without Explicit Confirmation Is Not Legitimate
Judgment question
docs.text: Can automation continue execution without explicit confirmation?

docs.title: Boundary condition
docs.text: Absence of confirmation is not equivalent to confirmation.

docs.title: Verdict
docs.text: Automation without explicit authorization does not possess execution legitimacy.

docs.title: Judgment question
docs.text: Can a system retry a payment when previous execution may still settle?

docs.title: Key boundary
docs.text: If a retry can result in multiple charges, automatic continuation is not legitimate.

docs.title: Verdict
docs.text: Retrying under this condition violates execution legitimacy. Responsibility must remain with explicit decision-makers, not automation.

docs.title: Judgment question
docs.text: Who holds responsibility when payment execution partially succeeds?

docs.title: Boundary condition
docs.text: Partial success does not grant authority for automatic completion or retry.

docs.title: Verdict
docs.text: Without renewed authorization, continuation improperly transfers responsibility from humans to systems.

docs.title: Should a Failed Payment Be Retried?
Judgment question
docs.text: Does the system have the right to retry a payment without new and explicit authorization?

docs.title: Conditions that invalidate automatic retry
docs.text:
Automatic retry is not legitimate when all of the following are true:

  • The result of execution is irreversible
  • Authorization is not fresh
  • Execution state is not fully confirmed

docs.title: Verdict
docs.text:
In this situation, retrying a payment without renewed authorization is not a legitimate system action.

Continuation shifts responsibility improperly from decision-makers to automation.
